editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Missal, with musical notation. F-20v: Opening Prayers, including Prayer of the Covenant, Ṣälotä Kidan, ጸሎተ፡ ኪዳን፡. F-56v: Ordinary of the Mass, Śǝrǝ`atä Qǝdase, F and v mention Abuna Basiliyos during the time he was metropolitan (1951-56), Bishop Abba Mika'el, and our king Haile Silassie (1930-1974). F-69v: Anaphora of the Apostles, Qǝdase Ḫawaryat. F-82v: Anaphora of Our Lord, Qǝdase Ǝgzi’ǝ. F-91v: Anaphora of Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bǝhǝnsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a. F-96v: Anaphora of John Chrysostom, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Afä Wärq, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈወርቅ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-104v: Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers, Qǝddase za-Śäläsǝtu, ቅዳሴ፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ምዕት፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-114v: Anaphora of Athanasius the Apostolic, Qǝddase Atǝnatewos, ቅዳሴ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡. F-123r: Anaphora of Basil of Caesarea, Qǝddase Baslǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. F-128v: Anaphora of Gregory, brother of Basil, Qǝddase Gorǝgorǝyos, ‘Ǝḫǝwä Baslǝyos., ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ እኅወ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. Cf. Oscar Löfgren, editor, Die beiden gewöhnlichen äthiopischen Gregorius-Anaphoren. Orientalia Christiana 83–86. Rome: Pont. Institutum Orientalium Studiorum, 1933. F-135r: Anaphora of Epiphanius, Qǝddase Estifanǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ኤጲፋንዮስ፡. F-141r: Anaphora of Cyril of Alexandria, Qǝddase Qerǝlos, ቅዳሴ፡ ቄርሎስ፡. F-147r: Anaphora of Jacob of Serugh, Qǝddase Ya’ǝkob Zä-Śǝrug, ቅዳሴ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡. See HSEA. F-149r: Anaphora of Dioscorus, Qǝddase Diosǝqoros, ቅዳሴ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡. F-152r: Anaphora of Gregory, the second, Qǝddase Gorǝgorǝyos Kalǝ‘, ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ካልዕ፡, also known as Anaphora of Gregory, the Wonder Worker, Qǝdase Gorǝgorǝyos, Gäbare mänkǝrat, ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ገባሬ፡ መንክራት፡.
